topic.title: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Upgrading from HP Helion Development Platform 1.1

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Commercial Installation and Configuration

body.p: If Helion Development Platform 1.1 is installed on Helion OpenStack 1.1, and the Helion OpenStack environment is updated to version 1.1.1, the Helion Developer Platform services must be stopped, and the control plane VMs must be restarted to complete the upgrade.

If Helion OpenStack version 1.1 is upgraded to version 1.1.1 without Helion Development Platform installed, no upgrade is necessary, and Helion Development Platform 1.2 can be installed normally. See HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Installation and Configuration for instructions for a new installation.

When Helion OpenStack is updated from 1.1. to 1.1.1, the Marketplace, Messaging, and Database services will automatically be updated to version 1.2. To update the Application Lifecycle Service, version 1.2 of the service must be downloaded and installed.

li.xref: Restarting Helion Development Platform control plane VMs

section.title: Stopping Helion Development Platform services
section.p: Before stopping services, check that the service control plane is in healthy state (this is required for trove and marketplace).
To run the Helion Devleopment Platform scripts, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Set dev_plat_service to the name of the service (trove/marketplace).
Set skip_ha_checks if the service control plane is not running in HA mode.
Provide path to the SSH private key that can be used to connect to the service control plane VMs.

li.p: Back up the ansible folder and move the latest build to its location:
Source credentials for the Nova account which was used to set up the Helion Developer Platform service by entering:

codeblock.codeph: cd /opt/stack/tripleo-ansible source overcloud.stackrc source /opt/stack/venvs/openstack/bin/activate ansible-playbook \ --extra-vars dev_plat_service=<service> \ --private-key <path to SSH private key> \ --skip_ha_checks=True \ -u heat-admin \ -i plugins/inventory/dev_platform_heat.py \ playbooks/dev-platform/dev_platform_pre_check.yml

li.p: If service is in healthy state, stop it by entering (if the service is not in a healthy state, contact customer support):

codeblock.codeph: ansible-playbook \ --extra-vars dev_plat_service=<service> \ --private-key <path to SSH private key> \ -u heat-admin \ -i plugins/inventory/dev_platform_heat.py \ playbooks/dev-platform/dev_platform_stop.yml
